data.title: Living in Izmir
data.text:
Izmir is located 38.41 latitude and 27.14 longitude and it is situated at 122 meters above sea level in Turkey with a population around 4 million.

Turkey is a vast Mediterranean geographical area with relatively temperate climatic conditions.

The landscape is covered with mountains mounted parallel to the coast.

Izmir is part of Aegean coastlines that have cold, rainy winters and hot, relatively dry summers. During the summer period in Izmir, the temperature is around 30 to 35 degrees Celsius. The temperature in winter is between 5 and 10 degrees Celsius. It rarely snows and the temperature is rarely below zero degrees.

The official language is Turkish.

To know more about Izmir and its surroundings please visit www.cityzeum.com/tourisme/izmir
